definition: the Five Classics of Confucianism, namely: the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1], the Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], and the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
five/5
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing
the Pentateuch/the five books of Moses in the Old Testament

sentences.english: That's not something they say themselves.
sentences.chinese: 五經中也並沒這麼說過。

sentences.english: It is one of the five books of the Old Testament that make up the Pentateuch .
sentences.chinese: 此卷是《舊約》的五書之一，它們構成“摩西五經”。

sentences.english: If a man wants to achieve what he wishes, Read the five sutras in front of the window.
sentences.chinese: 男兒欲遂平生志，五經勤向窗前讀。

sentences.english: Before Moses wrote his books, about 1450 B. C.
sentences.chinese: 摩西五經的寫作，在公元前1450年左右。

sentences.english: I thought God gave the law,the Torah,on Sinai.
sentences.chinese: 我以爲是神給的律法呢，《摩西五經》，在西乃山上。

sentences.english: This book contains 9 books in Traditional and Simplified Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 本書含《四書五經》，包括繁體中文和簡體中文版。

sentences.english: The first five books of the Hebrew Scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 摩西五經，希伯來聖經首五卷。

sentences.english: He gathered earlier writings to prepare what are called the Five Classics.
sentences.chinese: 句型寶典他蒐集以前的作品，編成了所謂的五經。

definition: to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts

Six Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Book of Rites 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], the lost Book of Music 樂經|乐经[Yue4 jing1], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
Imperial scholar from the Ming Dynasty onwards
Four Books, namely: the Great Learning 大學|大学, the Doctrine of the Mean 中庸, the Analects of Confucius 論語|论语, and Mencius 孟子
(Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)
Xiaojing (Classic of Filial Piety)
Classic of Rites
the Rites of Zhou (in Confucianism)
Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]

various sages/refers to the classical schools of thought, e.g. Confucianism 儒[ru2] represented by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3], Daoism 道[dao4] by Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3] and Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3], Mohism 墨[mo4] by Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3], Legalism 法[fa3] by Sunzi 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3] and Han Feizi 韓非子|韩非子[Han2 Fei1 zi3], and numerous others
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

the Confucian Six Arts, namely: rites or etiquette 禮|礼[li3] (禮儀|礼仪[li3 yi2]), music 樂|乐[yue3] (音樂|音乐[yin1 yue4]), archery 射[she4] (射箭[she4 jian4]), charioteering 御[yu4] (駕車|驾车[jia4 che1]), calligraphy or literacy 書|书[shu1] (識字|识字[shi2 zi4]), mathematics or reckoning 數|数[shu4] (計算|计算[ji4 suan4])/another name for the Six Classics 六經|六经[Liu4 jing1]
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
to check and correct
Yang Xiong (53 BC-18 AD), scholar, poet and lexicographer, author of the first Chinese dialect dictionary 方言[Fang1 yan2]

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
science
